docs.lead_paragraph: The gap between Americans who view the Affordable Care Act favorably and those who do not is smaller than at any time since 2012, according to a Kaiser Family Foundation poll.

headline.main: Poll on Health Care Law Shows Increased Support
headline.print_headline: Poll on Health Care Law Shows Increased Support After Smooth Enrollment Period

docs.abstract: Kaiser Health Tracking Poll finds 43 percent of respondents have unfavorable view of Affordable Care Act while 41 percent view it favorably, smallest gap between two sides since fall of 2012; also finds majority of respondents worry about Supreme Court case that could limit health insurance subsidies.
docs.snippet: The gap between Americans who view the Affordable Care Act favorably and those who do not is smaller than at any time since 2012, according to a Kaiser Family Foundation poll.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: Illinois Gov. Bruce Rauner, dogged in attempts to eliminate fees paid to unions by workers who choose not to join, has instructed state agencies to divert money from nonunion employee paychecks away from organized labor until a judge settles the matter.

headline.main: APNewsBreak: State to Divert 'Fair Share' Fees From Unions
headline.print_headline: APNewsBreak: State to Divert 'Fair Share' Fees From Unions

docs.lead_paragraph: An emerging bipartisan House deal changing how Medicare reimburses doctors ran into turbulence in the Senate Thursday over abortion, spotlighting a rare public disagreement between Congress' two top Democrats.

headline.main: House Medicare Deal Hits Senate Turbulence Over Abortion
headline.print_headline: House Medicare Deal Hits Senate Turbulence Over Abortion

docs.snippet: An emerging bipartisan House deal changing how Medicare reimburses doctors ran into turbulence in the Senate Thursday over abortion, spotlighting a rare public disagreement between Congress' two top Democrats.

docs.lead_paragraph: Public health officials Thursday issued a plea to parents of University of Oregon students to get their children vaccinated against meningitis after a sixth student has been found infected with the bacteria that can cause the potentially fatal disease.

headline.main: Officials Urge Meningitis Shots at University of Oregon
headline.print_headline: Officials Urge Meningitis Shots at University of Oregon

docs.lead_paragraph: An uncharacteristic joint effort by House Speaker John Boehner and his usual nemesis, Minority Leader Nancy Pelosi, to resolve a gnawing problem about how Medicare pays doctors underscores the political victories each sees in finally sweeping the issue off the deck — if they can.

headline.main: Boehner, Pelosi See Victories in Fixing Medicare Docs' Fees
headline.print_headline: Boehner, Pelosi See Victories in Fixing Medicare Docs' Fees

docs.lead_paragraph: With a decision due by summer in a Supreme Court case that could unravel President Barack Obama's health care law, a new poll finds many Americans have heard nothing about the case.

headline.main: Poll: Public Unaware Obama's Health Law Is Again in Jeopardy
headline.print_headline: Poll: Public Unaware Obama's Health Law Is Again in Jeopardy

docs.snippet: With a decision due by summer in a Supreme Court case that could unravel President Barack Obama's health care law, a new poll finds many Americans have heard nothing about the case.

docs.lead_paragraph: Over all, the Senate version hews closely to the budgetary intent of the House proposal. But the primary flash point is likely to be over military spending.

headline.main: Senate Republicans Rebuff House Colleagues With Their Budget Plan
headline.print_headline: Senate Republicans Rebuff House Colleagues With Their Budget Plan

docs.abstract: Senate Republicans release budget document that keeps tight limits on military spending and cuts trillions of dollars from health care and welfare; House Republicans are attempting to dodge spending caps by adding nearly $40 billion to military spending through 'emergency' war funding account; chart illustrates sharp contrasts between House and Senate Republican budget proposals and that of Obama administration.
docs.snippet: Over all, the Senate version hews closely to the budgetary intent of the House proposal. But the primary flash point is likely to be over military spending.

docs.lead_paragraph: Leaders of a Bronx nonprofit that provides drug and alcohol treatment to tens of thousands of New Yorkers have been indicted over an alleged scheme to plunder the charity and defraud Medicaid of more than $27 million, New York Attorney General Eric Schneiderman said.

headline.main: New York Charges Narco Freedom Executives in Alleged Medicaid Fraud Scheme
headline.print_headline: New York Charges Narco Freedom Executives in Alleged Medicaid Fraud Scheme

docs.lead_paragraph: Massachusetts could reap billions of dollars in economic activity if Boston is chosen to host the 2024 Olympics, the authors of a new report suggest, while adding there are still many questions that cloud the forecast.

headline.main: Report: Olympics Would Boost Massachusetts Economy
headline.print_headline: Report: Olympics Would Boost Massachusetts Economy

docs.snippet: Massachusetts could reap billions of dollars in economic activity if Boston is chosen to host the 2024 Olympics, the authors of a new report suggest, while adding there are still many questions that cloud the forecast.

docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. Senate Republicans on Wednesday proposed less aggressive federal budget cuts than their House counterparts, forgoing a massive revamp of the Medicare health system for seniors and setting up a conflict over defense spending.

headline.main: Senate Republican Budget Clashes With House on Defense
headline.print_headline: Senate Republican Budget Clashes With House on Defense

docs.snippet: U.S. Senate Republicans on Wednesday proposed less aggressive federal budget cuts than their House counterparts, forgoing a massive revamp of the Medicare health system for seniors and setting up a conflict over defense spending.
